arts.ttl: The 'energy' in the Middlesbrough dressing room as Carrick takes joy in one man's big moment
arts.sum: “I think we deserved it in the end, certainly in the way we played second half,” the Boro boss said. Coming from behind, Borges turned home Samuel Iling-Junior’s cross with ten minutes remaining to add to Kelechi Iheanacho’s equaliser and seal three huge points for Boro as the race for the play-offs really hots up.

arts.ttl: Kelechi Iheanacho scores as Middlesbrough fight back to beat Oxford
James Wilson earns Hearts dressing room right of passage as Lawrence Shankland and Craig Gordon reward history maker
arts.sum: Hearts starlet became Scotland's youngest ever player against Greece this week and was rewarded when he returned to his club.

arts.ttl: 'Understandable' - Middlesbrough boss responds to transfer interest Hayden Hackney - Teesside Live
arts.sum: And with that in mind, Carrick says it’s almost inevitable that top flight clubs will be sitting up and taking notice of the Redcar star. In a good way, you never really know if it’s going well or not because he just carries on playing and I think that’s a real strength of his to have such belief in himself.

arts.ttl: Borges continues at centre-back: Middlesbrough team news and predicted XI to face Oxford United
arts.sum: The latest Middlesbrough team news as Michael Carrick’s side face Oxford United in the Championship on Saturday. The post Borges continues at centre-back: Middlesbrough team news and predicted XI to face Oxford United appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: When Sol Brynn, Darragh Lenihan and Alex Bangura are likely to make their Middlesbrough returns
arts.sum: Michael Carrick is hoping Sol Brynn, Darragh Lenihan and Alex Bangura are able to make returns before the end of Middlesbrough ’s season. Along with Seny Dieng, who is definitely out for the rest of the campaign, and potentially the start of next, and Luke Ayling, who faces a race to play again this season too, the Boro trio have been working hard behind the scenes to try and push themselves to make long-awaited returns before the end of this season.

arts.ttl: ‘Stop the slide’ – Middlesbrough vs Oxford United prediction: The72
arts.sum: The72’s writers offer their Middlesbrough vs Oxford United prediction ahead of their Championship clash on Saturday. The post ‘Stop the slide’ – Middlesbrough vs Oxford United prediction: The72 appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Kelechi Iheanacho unseen Middlesbrough work and the striker's play-off impact desire
arts.sum: That’s because Iheanacho used the time off that players were given during the international break to head to Manchester and take up some personal training. Kelechi Iheanacho may have struggled to make an impact at Middlesbrough so far, but his extra work during the international break highlights how strong his desire is to change that.

arts.ttl: Preview: Middlesbrough vs. Oxford United - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's Championship clash between Middlesbrough and Oxford United, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.

arts.ttl: Van den Berg, McGree, Fry, Edmundson - Boro injury update ahead of Oxford
arts.sum: With the international break coming at an ideal time for Boro, they were without ten first-team players last time out against Luton Town, but also have George Edmundson and Dael Fry closing in on returns as they prepare for the business end of the season. Carrick will be safe in the knowledge that, despite having no fit centre-backs, Jonny Howson and Neto Borges managed to do a good job covering for the two games prior to the break - with Boro beating QPR and then keeping a clean sheet in the draw at Luton Town.
